laboratory_examinations.findings: Leukocyte count of 4.7 x 10^9 cells/L, hemoglobin level of 84 g/L, platelet count of 96 x 10^9 cells/L, absolute reticulocyte count of 322.5 x 10^9 cells/L.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Hemoglobin level decreased to 70 g/L two weeks later.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial level of 2950 U/L, later increased to 3450 U/L.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased to 359 U/L after 6 months of therapy.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Marked increase in hemoglobin, but no erythrocytes.
Most granulocytes were missing GPI-anchored proteins, consistent with diagnosis of PNH.
